I have a love/hate relationship with this game. It's definitely the kind of game you get addicted to and you'll sit down and play for hours on end; consequently, something always happens that kicks me off. Either a bug or an overly toxic player that makes me lose faith in the community. I must hand it over to the devs, though, because something is always added that makes me come back.

Dead by daylight, to put it shortly is a very good game it is essentially a game of cat and mouse. 4 players against 1 killer they have to work together to complete generators to power the exit gates to escape. I know what you might be thinking, is that the only way to escape? Yes and no. One other way to escape is by finding the hatch either by being the last player out of the four or having a key during the trial. In my opinion, the options of escape are very bland and do make the game seem very repetitive and cliche after a while. There are many different survivors and also killers to choose from, all being unique in there own way. All survivors have different perks and abilities they can use these for aid throughout the match. For example a perk called self-care this perk allows a player to heal themselves without a healing item. This can be useful in a number of scenarios. Moreover, once you level up a survivor to a certain level in the bloodweb there teachable perks will be available in other survivor's bloodwebs this also applies to killers. I think perks are a very good way to add some variety to the game but the thing about perks is that a lot of them are either useless or have very minimal impact throughout the game. This is why, in the higher ranks you do tend to see a lot of survivors and killers running the same old "meta" perks. Another complaint i have about this game are killers that facecamp and tunnel players (focus on one player at a time). This really does ruin the entire experience because it is almost like griefing. This pretty much, ruins the round and to put it bluntly really agitates and pisses you off. Another thing that i'd like to mention is the toxicity of the community, you will often see killers hitting survivors while on the hook and survivors crouch spamming and pointing at the killers while being stunned by a pallet. I really don't get why people provoke each other but it's just something i thought i would mention.



This game can honestly be a lot of fun, it is one of those games for me at least where i get burnt out, but after a couple of days i found myself back on it and having a lot of enjoyment. If you are a fan of strategic multiplayer horror games that honestly aren't very scary i highly recommend picking this up. It's a great game when you don't come across camping killers i would rate it a solid 8.5/10.

Purchased on sale by a friends request, can't really knock too much. It's a fun multi-player PvP title. I tend to enjoy every match I play, though I'm not too big on playing the Killer personally. Without friends I can't really recommend it though. Its just more enjoyable to scream like a ***** and argue with your friends as some big monstie bashes your head in with a sledgehammer.

I like the mechanics of the game and the way it makes you think as both survivors and the killer. Faster sort of paced game that gives a wide variety of killers and survivors each with special abilities making the game play different each time for the most part. The maps are fun to navigate for the most part. A couple of them feel overwhelming at first until you get use to it. I would highly recommend this game to others that enjoy survival horror based muliplayer games.
